title: I voted Remain, but now I just want MPs to end this awful limbo
text:
The political stalemate has allowed opinion to ferment into fury

On Saturday, MPs will be given another chance – perhaps their last – to approve a Brexit deal. Boris Johnson, urging his backbenchers not to lose heart, has compared Brexit to the final scenes of prison-break movie The Shawshank Redemption – in which the hero, having spent 19 years tunnelling his way out with a tiny chisel, must crawl through a sewer before he can break free.

It’s a typically rousing piece of rhetoric. As a Remainer, though, I have to admit to seeing this moment more like the ending of Titanic, when Leonardo DiCaprio – despite there being ample room on Kate Winslet’s raft – simply lets go and slides nobly under...
description: The political stalemate has allowed opinion to ferment into fury
